message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.EM, cs.EL, cs.CV 

The paper discusses a novel monitoring system concept that utilizes memristors for processing neural information in real-time. This falls under the field of computational neuroscience, which is typically categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of solid-state TiOx memristors, which are electronic devices that can change their resistance based on the history of applied voltage. This falls under the field of electronic engineering, which is typically categorized under cs.ET (Embedded Systems). The paper also discusses the use of memristive integrating sensing arrays for discriminating neuronal activity, which falls under the field of electrical engineering, typically categorized under cs.EM (Electromagnetics). The paper also discusses the potential for building scalable, yet energy-efficient on-node processors for big data, which falls under the field of computer vision, typically categorized under cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Finally, the paper discusses the use of voltage thresholds for discriminating significant neural activity from noise, which falls under the field of electronics, typically categorized under cs.EL (Electronics).
